content.question: Which of the following statements best describes the results seen in Figure 2 ?

choices.label: Individuals <math alttext="3-2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>III-2</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="3-3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>III-3</mtext></mrow></math> carry two different alleles of the <math alttext="F X N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>X</mi><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene, a mutant allele and a wild-type allele. Individual <math alttext="4-1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>IV-1</mtext></mrow></math> inherited two copies of the mutant allele.

Individuals <math alttext="3-2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>III-2</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="3-3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>III-3</mtext></mrow></math> carry two different alleles of the <math alttext="F X N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>X</mi><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene, a mutant allele and a wild-type allele. Individual <math alttext="4-1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>IV-1</mtext></mrow></math> inherited two copies of the wild-type allele.

Individuals <math alttext="3-2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>III-2</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="3-3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>III-3</mtext></mrow></math> both carry two wild-type alleles. Individual <math alttext="4-1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>IV-1</mtext></mrow></math> inherited two copies of the wild-type allele.

Individuals <math alttext="3-2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>III-2</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="3-3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>III-3</mtext></mrow></math> both carry two wild-type alleles, but individual <math alttext="4-1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>IV-1</mtext></mrow></math> inherited one copy of the wild-type allele and one copy of the mutant allele.

content.answer: Individuals <math alttext="3-2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>III-2</mtext></mrow></math> and <math alttext="3-3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>III-3</mtext></mrow></math> carry two different alleles of the <math alttext="F X N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>X</mi><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene, a mutant allele and a wild-type allele. Individual <math alttext="4-1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>IV-1</mtext></mrow></math> inherited two copies of the mutant allele.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
